DataElement.preferredName: Nausea Or Vomiting Sign or Symptom Occurrence Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not nausea or vomiting occurred.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Nausea Or Vomiting Sign or Symptom Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A disorder characterized by a queasy sensation and/or the urge to vomit._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Forceful ejection of the contents of the stomach through the mouth._Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining practitioner (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom)._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Nausea Or Vomiting Sign or Symptom
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A disorder characterized by a queasy sensation and/or the urge to vomit.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Forceful ejection of the contents of the stomach through the mouth.:Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining practitioner (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom).

Concepts.definition: A disorder characterized by a queasy sensation and/or the urge to vomit.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Forceful ejection of the contents of the stomach through the mouth.
Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining practitioner (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom).

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: signs that a person has a condition or disease. Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain(NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for NCI-INC0574290 - Reactogenicity Grading Scale Tables 000115. 2021-4-26 ak

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

DataElement.changeDescription: Created for NCI-INC0574290 - Reactogenicity Grading Scale Tables 000115. 2021-4-26 ak
